p: Staple foods (e.g. corn, wheat, rice, cassava, and potato) are generally used as bio-source for starch isolation. This can lead to competition between humans and industry in the consumption of staple foods. Therefore, it is necessary to search for new and inexpensive sources of starch to balance the use of staple foods as starch producing sources. The use of L.Â aromatica to isolate starch can be a potential resolution for the problem.
